intro: Helianthemum baeticum, commonly known as the Baetican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its small, leathery leaves and clustered flowers make it an attractive addition to rock gardens. Helianthemum baeticum is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated for its ability to thrive in challenging environments.
